channel.title: Content on Jeff Cavanagh
channel.description: Recent content in Content on Jeff Cavanagh

item.title: Minimzing World Electrical Cost
item.description: Indirect Costs of the Various Energy Sources Coast Coefficients by Fuel Source (Production, Import, Export, Consumption) Packages Used to Build Model Upper Limit on Fuel Sources Defining Constraints Energy Production Capacity by Nation Defining the Objective Function Putting the Constraints Together Solving the Problem For my graduate project I created an optimization model that analyzes the cost of electricity world wide and determines how expensive the indirect costs of fossil fuel consumption need to be in order for the installation of renewable electricity sources to be a more financially viable alternative.

item.title: SPRINT 8
item.description: What is SPRINT 8?? Issues with Traditional Cardio and Dieting Long Duration, Slow, Steady State Cardio Dieting for Weight Loss (Heavy Caloric Restriction) Critical Components of any Training Program How SPRINT 8 Uses this Information Sprint Intensity vs. Steady State Cardio SPRINT 8 Benchmarks Benefits Short Term Long Term How to do It! Format Exercise Selection Nutrition Other Considerations SPRINT 8 is a sprint style, interval-based cardio workout created by Coach Phil Campbell.

item.title: Machine Learning in R
item.description: Supervised vs. Unsupervised Learning Supervised Learning Tree Based Methods Decision Trees Bagging/Random Forest Boosting Generalized Additive Models Support Vector Machines Natural Language Processing Unsupervised Learning Clustering Dimensionality Reduction Principal Component Analysis Summary Pros and Cons of Decision Trees Machine learning is a broad and ever evolving topic and any good data scientist needs to have a strong grasp of the major techniques to know when to use which method and how best to apply them.

item.title: Philosophy
item.description: To become empty is to become one with the divine; this is the Way. - Awa Kenzo Work done for a reward is much lower than work done in the Yoga of wisdom. Set thy heart upon thy work, but never on its reward. Work not for reward, but never cease to do thy work. - The Bhagavad Gita Very few go astray who comport themselves with restraint.

item.title: About Jeff
item.description: ** Welcome to my Site! ** My name is Jeff and I am a data scientist living in Boston, MA. I created this website as an outlet for my work, interests, and outlook on life. I believe that the potential for growth and improvement (in virtually anything) is limitless and that there is no problem without a solution. This website is a manifestation of those beliefs that showcases my abilities, passions, and influences.

item.title: Personalities
item.description: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength. - Arnold Schwarzenegger For me life is about continuously being hungry. The meaning of life is not simply to exist, to survive, but to move ahead, to group, to achieve, to conquer. - Arnold Schwarzenegger Impossible is just a big word thrown around by small men who find it easier to live in the world they’ve been given than to explore the power they have to change it.

item.title: Poetry
item.description: Nothing Gold Can Stay The Road Not Taken Nothing Gold Can Stay Nature’s first green is gold, Her hardest hue to hold, Her early leaf’s a flower; But only so an hour. Then leaf subsides to leaf. So Eden sank to grief, So dawn goes down to day. Nothing gold can stay. - Robert Frost The Road Not Taken Two roads diverged in a yellow wood,

item.title: Processing Text Data
item.description: Setup Transforming Raw Text into Data Frame Text Analysis Counts Document Frequencies Text data cannot be processed identically to numerical or categorical data. Is there a way then to analyze text data and obtain insight from it?? Of course! All it takes is an adapted approach and a little more work upfront. Quite a bit of potential data is unstructured and textual in nature.

item.title: Text Excerpts
item.description: Just Mercy Just Mercy We are all broken by something. We have all hurt someone and have been hurt. We all share the condition of brokenness even if our brokenness is not equivalent… …Thomas Merton said: We are bodies of broken bones. I guess I’d always known but never fully considered that being broken is what makes us human. We all have our reasons. Sometimes we’re fractured by the choices we make; sometimes we’re shattered by things we would never have chosen.

item.title: Web Scraping
item.description: Setup CSS Tool Data rvest Selenium Unfortunately, not all data is contained within neat data frames. There is a virtually unlimited amount of data contained within web pages, but extracting and manipulated that information into a usable and familiar format is a major obstacle. This post will serve as an introduction on how to extract data from web pages using R and Python with the packages rvest and Selenium.

item.title: Movies
item.description: Good Will Hunting Hitch Lion King The Replacements Rocky Balboa Creed Good Will Hunting Real loss is only possible when you love something more than you love yourself. - Sean Maguire You’ll have bad times, but it’ll always wake you up to the good stuff you weren’t paying attention to. - Sean Maguire Hitch Never lie, steal, cheat, or drink.

item.title: Spiritual
item.description: Nothing is more practical than finding God, than falling in Love in a quite absolute, final way. What you are in love with, what seizes your imagination, will affect everything. It will decide what will get you out of bed in the morning, what you do with your evenings, how you spend your weekends, what you read, whom you know, what breaks your heart, and what amazes you with joy and gratitude.

item.title: Spiritual

item.title: Endgame
item.description: Week 1 Monday: Compound Lower Body Tuesday: Compound Upper Body Wednesday: Sprint/Core Thursday: Uni-Lateral Lower Body Friday: Uni-Lateral Upper Body Saturday: Multifunctional Week 2 Monday: Compound Lower Body Tuesday: Compound Upper Body Wednesday: Sprint/Core Thursday: Uni-Lateral Lower Body Friday: Uni-Lateral Upper Body Saturday: Multifunctional Complex Options I put this workout together in the summer of 2019. At its core it is an upper/lower split.

item.title: Hiking Trail Analysis
item.description: Setup Partitioning the Data Interaction of Predictor Variables Model Building Linear Regression LDA QDA Logistic Regression KNN Cross Validation Tree-Based Methods Bagging Random Forest GBM Classification Predictions The following was my final project for a Predictive Analytics course. It analyzed data on hiking trails throughout the US and created and compared models predicting whether or not a given trail will be rated above 4.

item.title: Statistical Modeling Starter Kit
item.description: Setup Regression Models Simple Linear Regression Multiple Linear Regression Classification models Logistic Regression Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) Quadratic Discriminant Analysis (QDA) K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) Cross-Validation This post will cover some basic methods of regression analysis and how to apply them in R. It will also serve as a warm-up for the posts that explore more advanced machine learning and AI methods.

item.title: NFL Team Wins Regression Analysis
item.description: This was a final project I completed for my Regression and Time Series Analysis Course. I took data from the 2017 NFL season and used it to see what metrics were significant in predicting the number of wins a team would achieve. Here is the write up of the project

item.title: NFL Team Wins Regression Analysis
item.description: This was a final project I completed for my Regression and Time Series Analysis Course. I took data from the 2017 NFL season and used SPSS to determine what metrics were significant in predicting the number of wins a team would achieve. Here is the write up of the project
